docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Internet Protocol exposes Websocket, HTTP, and Json modules to the blueprint. The goal of this plugin is, in addition to making it easier, to give you full control over managing connections and manipulating messages via Json.

Key Features:

  • WebSocket Connections: Effortlessly establish real-time, two-way communication channels with servers using WebSockets.
  • HTTP Requests: Seamlessly send and receive data with HTTP requests, supporting GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE and more methods.
  • Blueprint-Friendly: Intuitive blueprint integration allows for quick and easy setup within your projects.
  • Asynchronous Operations: All networking processes are handled asynchronously, maintaining smooth gameplay without big performance hitches.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• InternetProtocol World Subsystem.
  • Websocket Client side only.
  • HTTP Client side only.
  • Json.
  • RawFunctionLibrary.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
Video Showcase Get UE5 Plugin

OBS: If the plugin has good relevance, I will make the version for Unreal Engine 4.27 available for free.

docs.title: Create HTTP object
docs.text:
• 1- Right click in any blueprint graph to open search box.
  • 2- Search by InternetProtocolSubsystem.
  • 3- Search by CreateHTTPObject from InternetProtocolSubsystem node.

docs.title: 1- Construct HTTP
docs.text:
• Construct HTTP.
  • Must be called before use any http function.

docs.title: 2- Is Valid
docs.text: • Check if the http was built and is valid.

docs.title: 3- Reset
docs.text:
• Shutdown http module.
  • ConstructHTTP must be called again before use any node.

docs.title: 4- Set URL
docs.text: • Set url.

docs.title: 5- Get URL
docs.text: • Get url.

docs.title: 6- Encode URL
docs.text: • Encode url to ANSII.

docs.title: 7- Decode URL
docs.text: • Decode url from ANSII.

docs.title: 8- Set Verb
docs.text: • Set request metod.

docs.title: 9- Get Verb
docs.text: • Get request metod.

docs.title: 10- Set Parameters
docs.text: • Set url parameters.

docs.title: 11- Get Parameter
docs.text: • Get get parameter value by name.

docs.title: 12- Get All Parameters
docs.text: • Get all url parameters.

docs.title: 13- Append to Header
docs.text:
• Add headers.
  • Reseting headers you need to call node Reset and reconstruct http.

docs.title: 14- Get Header
docs.text: • Get header value by name.

docs.title: 15- Get Header
docs.text: • Get all headers.

docs.title: 16- Set Content As String
docs.text: • Sets the content of the request as a string encoded as UTF8.

docs.title: 17- Set Content
docs.text: • Sets the content of the request (optional data). Usually only set for POST requests.

docs.title: 18- Get Content
docs.text: • Get content of the request.

docs.title: 19- Get Content Lenght
docs.text: • Get content size in bytes.

docs.title: 20- Get Content Type
docs.text: • Get type of content.

docs.title: 21- Set Timeout
docs.text: • Set request timeout.

docs.title: 22- Get Timeout
docs.text: • Get request timeout.

docs.title: 23- Clear Timeout
docs.text: • Reset timeout.

docs.title: 24- Process Request
docs.text: • Called to begin processing the request.

docs.title: 25- Cancel Request
docs.text: • Called to cancel a request that is still being processed.

docs.title: 26- Tick Request
docs.text: • Use to tick request

docs.title: Events
docs.text: • Events can be called or assigned without construct websocket.

docs.title: 1- On Completed
docs.text: • Delegate called when the request is complete.

docs.title: 2- On Progress
docs.text: • Delegate called to update the request/response progress.

docs.title: 3- On Will Retry
docs.text: • Delegate called when the request will be retried.

docs.title: Create Json object
docs.text:
• 1- Right click in any blueprint graph to open search box.
  • 2- Search by InternetProtocolSubsystem.
  • 3- Search by CreateJsonObject from InternetProtocolSubsystem node.

docs.title: 1- Construct Json
docs.text:
• Construct Json.
  • It also reset json object.
  • Must be called before use any json function.

docs.title: 2- Construct Json From String
docs.text:
• Construct Json from string.
  • It also reset json object.
  • Must be called before use any json function.

docs.title: 3- Is Valid
docs.text: • Check if json is valid.

docs.title: 4- To String
docs.text: • Parse json data to string.

docs.title: 5- Reset
docs.text:
• Reset json and clear all fields.
  • Construct Json or Construct Json From String must be called again.

docs.title: 16- Set object field
docs.text:
• Set a json object field.
  • Search by CreateJsonObject from InternetProtocolSubsystem node to assign to object field.

docs.title: 18- Remove field
docs.text: • Remove field by name.

docs.title: 19- Has field
docs.text: • Check if json has field.

docs.title: Create a websocket object
docs.text:
• 1- Right click in any blueprint graph to open search box.
  • 2- Search by InternetProtocolSubsystem.
  • 3- Search by CreateWebsocket from InternetProtocolSubsystem node.

docs.title: 1- Construct Websocket
docs.text:
• Construct websocket
  • Protocols: ws and wss
  • Must be called before use any websocket function.

docs.title: 2- Is Websocket Valid
docs.text: • Check if the websocket was built and is valid.

docs.title: 3- Connect
docs.text:
• Construct websocket
  • Protocols: ws and wss
  • Must be called before use any websocket function.

docs.title: 4- Is Connected
docs.text: • Check if websocket is connected.

docs.title: 5- Close
docs.text: • Close websocket connection.

docs.title: 5- Reset
docs.text:
• Shutdown websocket module.
  • Construct Websocket must be called again before use any node.

docs.title: 5- Send
docs.text: • Send string or json message.

docs.title: 5- Send Raw
docs.text: • Send raw message.

docs.title: Events
docs.text: • Events can be called or assigned without construct websocket.

docs.title: 1- On Connected
docs.text: • Delegated called when websocket connect to server.

docs.title: 2- On Connection Error
docs.text: • Delegated called when websocket failure to connect to server.

docs.title: 3- On Close
docs.text: • Delegated called when connection is closed.

docs.title: 4- On Message Sent
docs.text: • Delegated called when websocket receive a message.

docs.title: 5- On Message Sent
docs.text: • Delegated called when a message be sent.

docs.title: 6- On Raw Message
docs.text: • Delegated called when websocket receive a raw message.
